tweet: Congratulations to New Orleans native Albert Woodfox for his book, Solitary, being on this year’s @NewYorker National Book Awards list. Albert’s fight for freedom was long fought and earned. I’m proud to know him and have worked with him along his journey. https://www.newyorker.com/books/page-turner/the-2019-national-book-awards-longlist-nonfiction …

Cokie Roberts was one of a kind. Her trailblazing work and brilliant leadership served as an inspiration to many. New Orleans and the rest of the world has lost a legend. I am saddened by her loss and send my condolences to her family in need of solace at this time. pic.twitter.com/gpbdAxvuMb
Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth to all those celebrating in my district and across the country. Thank you for your immeasurable contributions!

Today, @HomelandDems Chairman @BennieGThompson and I sent a letter to ICE regarding Mr. Leal’s status. We requested an urgent review of his case to consider immediate deferred action. pic.twitter.com/puhvYjTfn5
Let us pay tribute to the lives of innocent victims and loved ones lost 18 years ago today on September 11th. May we #NeverForget their heroism in the face of hate.

I’ve been concerned about Yoel Alonso Leal’s treatment and have also been in contact with ICE about his case. After speaking with ICE leadership, he unfortunately still remains in custody. I will continue working with my colleagues to advocate for the freedom Yoel deserves.

On #LaborDay today, we recognize the tenacity and tireless organizing of American workers whose efforts have built and sustained our country’s workforce. Thank you for your continued contributions to society.
